name: Charter Club Resort of Naples Bay

reviews.title: Awesome facility and location !!!!
reviews.text: Charter Club is superb. cozy, quaint, right in the heart of old Naples, and on the bay. Can't beat it for location and a relaxing vacation. Highly recommend it! Been there twice now and plan on returning next year as well.

reviews.title: Charter Club is a winner!!
reviews.text: Charter Club Resort is by far one of the best resorts I have been to. 5 stars!!

reviews.title: Charter Club on Naples Bay is GREAT!!!
reviews.text: Fantastic facilities for a great, quiet vacation and a superb location. Highly recommend!!!!!!

reviews.title: Bit of a let down!
reviews.text: A bit of a let down! Pretty shabby apartment (building 3), however view over bay superb. Bar seemed to close very early, and no vending machines to provide any water etc if arriving after 6pm. Good location.

reviews.title: Great resort
reviews.text: Excelent resort. Stayed end August 2004 Unit was superb 2 bed and very spacious.Blocks 6-11 have been refurmished as of one of these.Staff very friendly and helpful . Great free welcome drinks party on the Monday night, Was billed as for 1 hour we fell out after 3.

reviews.title: The Charter Club on Naples Bay was great.
reviews.text: Ony 33 units so there is a friendly atmosphere with the fellow guests.

reviews.title: Terrific vacation spot! All the comforts of home!
reviews.text: Only minus points .It is 8 blocks from the beach(there are free bikes if you are up for it)

reviews.title: Overpriced
reviews.text: The pool is quite small , but with only 33 units this is not a big problem and finally there is some construction going on accross the road so there was some noise at times during the day

We arrived at the apartments on a very rainy afternoon and were given the most warm welcome by our very informative and friendly receptionist Mary. Although we were a little early for check in our apartment was ready with all the paperwork completed.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: When we opened the door to our apartment , the views really took our breath away, the apartments all have a stunning view of the bay, really beautiful.
reviews.title: Excellent stay, kid friendly resort

likes.disliked: — No elevators, older resort, but well maintained.

reviews.text: The apartment itself was lovley, the kitchen was really well stocked with all sorts of what I would call extra electrical items. There was a lovely balacony which was fully screened so protecting you from any nasty biters !!.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location

likes.liked: — Quiet, great location, proximity to beah and good restaurants.
likes.disliked: — If I had to make a negative it would be a very, very minor one in that the bathrooms could do with modernising.

reviews.text: The pool area although quite small was beautifully clean and maintained and has the most fabulous views. There were plenty of sunbeds and parasols available. The resort offers some tours , one is a boat trip on the bay , it is a lovely trip for all the family, the captain Rick made sure that we saw Dolphins, we had did some jet skiing through the mangroves , then on to a private beach, and then back to the resort touring the millionaires mansions.
reviews.title: Great vacation retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are very friendly and go out of their way to help and advise. I would not hesitate to go back to the resort , it is in the heart of the historic district and within walking distance to the beach and lovely restaurants, it is a real gem.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Rec'd a week from a friends timeshare and wanted to go back to Naples. Great location. Close to beach, downtown and Naples Bay. You can tell this was a premium resort many years ago. It is still nice but not a 5 star by any means. The pool area is small but ended up being a great place for our 4 and 6 year olds. The Tiki bar is pricey but we were told by one of the workers it is non-profit...which if this is true made us feel better. The staff was great and mostly accommodating. Free bikes, beach chairs, umbrellas and toys. I wish they catered more to families but it seems most of their clients are over 70 years old. Naples is pricey but with a little research you can find inexpensive outings and things for kids. Great zoo, great beaches and enough other things (mini golf, dolphin tours) to keep you busy for a week. The dolphin tour was well worth the money. We stayed in 11A. Two bedrooms, great screened in porch, decent kitchen and most modern conveniences. The bathrooms, especially the master, were too small and you could tell they were built in the 70's. They were also a tad rundown if not a little dirty when we arrived. However, we didn't spend our time in the condo and the cooking and sleeping accommodations were more than acceptable. My suggestions would be to update (at least 11a) a little bit and offer more for families if not just more information. Otherwise we had great weather and nice accommodations.
reviews.title: Nice not Fabulous Family Vacation

reviews.text: Myself and two friends met in Naples to enjoy a girls getaway for a week. We booked the Charter Club Resort through a time share and were very pleased with our stay. From the limited reviews I had read before leaving home, I was a little worried. (We are all a little "high maintenance!") haha!
reviews.title: Fantastic Getaway!

likes.disliked: — Lots of stairs to get to our 3rd floor condo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were thrilled with our entire stay at the Charter Club Resort.
reviews.title: wonderful holiday

reviews.text: The condo was a very good size with a well stocked kitchen, nicely decorated dining and livingroom area. The master bedroom had a comfortable king size bed, lots of closet space, television, dvd player,inroom safe and a full ensuite.The other bedroom also has its own tv and two single beds with the main bathroom right outside the door. There was also a stackable washer/dryer unit which is handy. All rooms were very clean, modern and the full-screened balcony overlooking the bay was the perfect place to enjoy your morning coffee or a nightcap.
reviews.title: Families - Best places to stay in NAPLES

reviews.text: The pool area is very clean, lots of lounging chairs and the tiki bar provided great pina colodas . The hot tub was our favorite place late at night over looking the bay with the sky full of stars. The trees are all wrapped in white mini lights giving it a magical atmosphere.
reviews.title: Charming

aka: Charter Club Resort Of Naples Bay Hotel Naples
description: In the heart of Old Naples, Charter Club Of Naples Bay gives you the best of secluded relaxation, alongside exciting activities and entertainment. Stroll along Naples seven miles of sugar-white sand beaches. Enjoy the area’s array of restaurants, galleries, boutiques and shops. Experience the area’s championship golf courses, tennis courts, boating and deep-sea fishing. The 33-unit Charter Club Resort Of Naples Bay, on the southwestern coast of Florida, is comprised of 11 three-story buildings overlooking beautiful Naples Bay and sits on the premier corner of Tenth Avenue South and Tenth Street South.This non-smoking resort's two-bedroom/two-bath condos sleep six and have views of Naples Bay, which guests can enjoy from their 30-foot screened lanais. They are designed with high-quality furnishings, TVs and DVD players. The condos provide 1,240 sq. ft. of living space, with living and dining areas, fully-equipped kitchens, wet bars, separate bedrooms and washers/dryers.
